answers.answer: Hi,Low carbon dioxide levels in the blood can occur in case of uncontrolled diabetes, metabolic disorders, kidney failure or due to hyperventilation. Over use of nicotine or it’s withdrawal can lead to metabolic derangements causing changes blood carbon dioxide levels. I would recommend that you encourage your son to visit a psychiatrist and a physician for complete work up and confirmation of the cause for these symptoms and counselling for quitting smoking. Best.

question: my son was strong & healthy. He got mono and has healed from that. since, he is now having panic attacks & continues to smoke, he hangs his head, his Carbon Dioxide level is low in his blood work.he's 24, newly married... help me!
title: nicotine
